title: Whether free laborers ever sleep quote - purpose

content.prompt:
“We do not know whether free laborers ever sleep. . . . The free laborer must work or starve. He is more of a slave than the negro, because he works longer and harder for less allowance than the slave, and has no holiday, because the cares of life with him begin when its labors end. He has no liberty, and not a single right.”

George Fitzhugh, Cannibals All! or, Slaves Without Masters, 1857

The excerpt above reflects the common argument in the antebellum South that

choices.label: capitalism was the economic system most likely to generate wealth and happiness for the most people
the South needed to change to survive
slaves lived better than northern factory workers
industrialists took care of their workers’ welfare
